intro: Saussurea yakusimensis, commonly known as the Yakushima saffron, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Japan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stem and dense clusters of yellow flowers. The plant is notable for its medicinal properties, with its flowers and roots traditionally used in herbal remedies. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and ecological sensitivity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
